result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Termaat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP but only after serving 2 years of Initial Confinement in Count 1 of 21CF339.
Consecutive to: Case 21CF399

superMiscConds.notes: Not allowed to vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No contact with victim, victim's family or their residence.  No contact with known drug users or sellers except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.  No unsupervised contact with minors without prior agent approval.
Provide DNA sample by 9-19-2022.  Assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.  Maintain / Obtain full time employment.
